AvProblem.comment: <2100 m steep slopes with smooth ground (grass, rocks)
dry-snow avalanches: no prevalent avalanche problem

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Moderate danger of glide-snow avalanches, otherwise favourable situation
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is moderate. Main problem: gliding snow avalanches. On steep smooth slopes in all aspects agove 2400 m, medium glide-snow avalanches are possible, indicated by glide cracks. No current risk of dry-snow avalanches, at most superficial layers or older drifts could trigger, usually only with large additional loading. A cautious route selection is advised. Caution near cornices, which could break. On sunny slopes, mostly small loose-snow avalanches can be expected if there is solar radiation.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Snow is irregularly distributed due to storm-strength winds. Crests and ridges are utterly windblown, gullies and bowls and zones behind protruberances are filled to the brim with drifted snow. Older drifts are often hardened, many surfaced are wind-compacted. The drifts are bonding well with the snowpack beneath them. Fresher drifts have weak intermediate layers, sometimes with graupel, and are prone to triggering. The fresh snow has settled well. At intermediate altitudes the snowpack is often moist down to the ground. The weight-load of the fresh snow reinforces the process of gliding over smooth ground.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: Nocturnal hours: Clear skies, dry, good outgoing radiation. Thursday daytime: A sunny and mild day, merely diffuse light conditions in the afternoon. At 2000 m: +6 degrees. Moderate to brisk W/SW winds, strong SW winds in the foehn regions.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Friday will be very sunny. The danger of dry-snow avalanches will recede further. Danger of glide-snow avalanches will persist.

AvProblem.comment: <2500 m steep slopes with smooth ground (grass, rocks)
dry-snow avalanches: no prevalent avalanche problem

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Glide-snow avalanches persist, mostly favourable conditions at high altitudes
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is moderate due to gliding snow. On steep smooth slopes in all aspects agove 2400 m, medium glide-snow avalanches are possible, indicated by glide cracks. No current risk of dry-snow avalanches, at most superficial layers or older drifts could trigger, usually only with large additional loading. A cautious route selection is advised. Caution near cornices, which could break. On sunny slopes, mostly small loose-snow avalanches can be expected if there is solar radiation.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Snow is irregularly distributed due to storm-strength winds. Crests and ridges are utterly windblown, gullies and bowls and zones behind protruberances are filled to the brim with drifted snow. Older drifts are often hardened, many surfaced are wind-compacted. The drifts are bonding well with the snowpack beneath them. Fresher drifts have weak intermediate layers, sometimes with graupel, and are prone to triggering. The fresh snow has settled well. At intermediate altitudes the snowpack is often moist down to the ground. The weight-load of the fresh snow reinforces the process of gliding over smooth ground.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: Nocturnal hours: Clear skies, dry, good outgoing radiation. Thursday daytime: A sunny and mild day, merely diffuse light conditions in the afternoon. At 2000 m: +6 degrees. Moderate to brisk W/SW winds, strong SW winds in the foehn regions.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Friday will be very sunny. The danger of dry-snow avalanches will recede further. Danger of glide-snow avalanches will persist.

AvProblem.comment: isolated on smooth, steep grass-covered slopes

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger is low. On steep smooth slopes in all aspects, small glide-snow avalanches aer possible in zones which have not yet dischafged. Glide cracks should be circumvented. No prevalent problem for dry-snow avalanches. Small avalanches can be triggered in extremely steep terrain, mostly by large additional loading. Apart from the danger of being buried in snow, the risks of being forced to take a fall need to be taken into consideration. A cautious route selection is advisesd.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Little snow on the ground. Often the crust is capable of bearing loads, but softens up during the course of the day. Many surfaces are wind-hardened or icy. The snowpacks up to intermediate altitudes is moist down to the ground, which enhances the snowpack gliding downhill over smooth ground surfaces.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: Nocturnal hours: Clear skies, dry, good outgoing radiation. Thursday daytime: A sunny and mild day, merely diffuse light conditions in the afternoon. At 2000 m: +6 degrees. Moderate to brisk W/SW winds, strong SW winds in the foehn regions.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Friday will be very sunny. The danger of dry-snow avalanches will recede further. Danger of glide-snow avalanches will persist.
